page.title: 19Well House Inn, Chipstead
page.content: There are three{Puplic Houses}in the area: two of them in Lower Kingswood, but the oldest and most popular is the Well House Inn near Chipstead (to the east of Kingswood). The pub takes its name from the well in its garden. Although an old building it has only been a pub since the last century when a group of local farmers made a petition for the original{tea-rooms}to be granted a licence to sell alcoholic drinks, Today the pub. can boast a{good {trade,}people travel from all over the locality to enjoy a drink in pleasant historic surroundings. It is usually quite full at lunchtimes (when{bar {meals}are served) and each evening. It is especially popular during the summer months when customers like to sit outside in the pub's attractive {garden}at the rear of the pub..
